result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A. Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Special disposition under 973.015 if paid in full by due date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A. Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
3:40 p.m. Defendant Matthew A. Garcia in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. 
Court Sentence
Fine - $200 inclusive of costs 
Special disposition under 973.015 if paid in full by February 8, 2016 at 3:00 p.m.  
Appeal rights given. 
Review hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:12 p.m. Defendant Matthew A. Garcia in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm504 and 15tr3156. Defendant has not found an attorney - has not contacted any attorney or public defender's office. Right to counsel - waiver free and voluntary - Defendant enters guilty plea - Defendant provided Plea Questionnaire to complete. Off record 3:18 p.m.

3:10 p.m. Defendant Matthew A. Garcia in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm405 and 15tr3156.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel. Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant appeared at Clerk of Court's office - was sent to Kathy B. - At 4:08 p.m. an off the record discussion was held between defendant and Judge - Judge sets $500 sig bond; notifies defendant to contact pd's office and sets Adjourned Initial Appearance for 12-21-15 at 2:30 p.m. Defendant directed to Clerk's office to sign bond.
3:35 p.m. Defendant does not appear. Steven Michlig appears for State of Wisconsin. Defendant had contacted JA to advise would be late. Court authorizes warrant.
